result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brenda A Nogalski

defendant.name: Nogalski, Brenda A
defendant.address: N57 W13916 Thurston Avenue, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:25 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Brenda A Nogalski not in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Brenda A Nogalski.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Gutierrez advises he was able to speak with his client this morning and she is not able to appear due to transportation issues.  State has no objection to the court staying a capias and adjourning the matter for status.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update; he notes his client is on WCS monitoring and is enrolled in treatment.  Atty. Gutierrez requests a further proceedings in about 30 days.  Court will authorize but stay the issuance of a capias and will adjourn about 30 days for continued status.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Update from WCS - Defendant is now compliant.
Bail/bond hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
WCS SCRAM failure to pay letter.
Hearing on October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:17 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brenda A Nogalski in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Brenda A Nogalski.  Court first notes there was a WCS non-compliance with SCRAM filed on 8/2/2022.  Atty. Gutierrez presents statements with respect to the non-compliance and the defendant is currently in counseling as well.  State is asking the court to admonish the defendant and take no further action today as this was the first WCS non-compliance.  Court admonishes the defendant for the non-compliance and warns that if there are future non-compliance reports filed a capias could be issued.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he is requesting another further proceedings in 60 days.  State has no objection.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
from Alliance Counseling Center with update
Wisconsin Community Service SCRAM non-compliance letter dated 8/2/2022 received and filed. **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - to be addressed at the next hearing**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:45 AM Defendant Brenda A Nogalski in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez is asking for either a plea/sentencing or status date in 60 days based on treatment program defendant will be enrolled in.  Court resets matter for status.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:14 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Brenda A Nogalski in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he is requesting a further proceeding date in about 60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty. Luis Gutierrez.
Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Lau.
Hearing on May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS within one business day.

02:09 PM Defendant Brenda A Nogalski in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Victim A appears in Court and is asking for contact with the defendant.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
